title: 110_hr1407
content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" eliminates the dollar limit on the deduction for interest on education loans and raises the phaseout threshold based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" removes the dollar limit on education loan interest deduction and adjusts the phaseout threshold based on modified adjusted gross income. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Repeal of termination of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. SEC. 4. EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions to $5,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is after December 31, 2007. In amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, qualified scholarship definitions are expanded to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. The terms 'qualified higher education expenses' and 'eligible educational institution' are defined in section 529(e). Special rules for teaching and research assistants regarding tuition reduction programs are also modified. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 expand qualified scholarship definitions to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. These amendments apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods starting after that date. SEC. 6. Expansion of educational expenses allowed as part of Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants will not reduce the Hope Scholarship Credit. The Hope Scholarship Credit now includes fees, books, supplies, and equipment for courses at eligible educational institutions. Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants will not affect the credit. Amendments apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education in academic periods starting after that date. SEC. 7. The sunset provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 do not apply to certain education provisions in subtitles A, B, and D of title IV of the Act.
